poem:
### In London, Talks

A city of rain  
holds its breath,  
diplomats whisper  
like leaves in the park,  
while a world aches  
  
for resolution—  
heavy pressures,  
inevitable endings.  
  
Zelenskyy,  
in the fog,  
seeks a bridge  
beneath trembling skies—  
where will the tide  
finally rest?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Zelenskyy to meet European leaders in London for talks on ending Ukraine war Volodymyr Zelenskyy is meeting the leaders of the UK, France and Germany in London on Monday amid heavy pressure on Ukraine from the Trump administration to cede territory it currently holds in efforts to reach a quick conclusion to the war. The talks in London follow several days of negotiations between US and Ukrainian officials, which ended on Saturday without an apparent". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
